Html:
Hi there

 I'm a beginner of D3,and tring to build the Intensity Chart sample. 

 Just like BBauer42 pointed out, I got an error as followed.

        'ViewportHostPanel' does not exist in XML namespace 'http://research.microsoft.com/DynamicDataDisplay/1.0'. Line 18 Position 5.   

  I checked the Microsoft.Research.DynamicDataDisplay.Charts namespace and could not find the ViewportHostPanel class declaration in there.

  So,Could anyone tell me what should i do to be able to build Intensity Chart with no error.

  I am using VS2010,and got the sample from DynamicDataDisplay Sources v0.3.4703.0\src\DevSamples\IntensityChart.

  I think the reference setting to DynamicDataDisplay is good.


  Thanks!

Hi,

This is a core sample - only two projects. It should build without any problems.
http://cid-eaf0a921258b5980.office.live.com/self.aspx/.Public/D3/DynamicDataDisplay%20Sources%20v0.3.4703.0%20for%20JiveAtFive.zip
--
Best regards,
Mikhail Brinchuk

Thank you,Mikhail,your prompt reply!

 I downloaded the new one that should be build without any problems,you supplied.

But,I got same result. So,I think I have something wrong environment setting of VS2010 or wrong dll of the DynamicDataDisplay.

I think the error would occur because that ViewportHostPanel class declaration is not exist in the Microsoft.Research.DynamicDataDisplay.Charts namespace.

It means that I have wrong DynamicDataDisplay.dll? Can you see it in your dll?

I have opened D3's assembly with Reflector, and found ViewportHostPanel
there.
I don't have more ideas as I don't have all necessary information.
Call me at skype - mikhail.brinchuk.

Mikhail.

Hi,Mikhail

 I don't have skype account,but I appreciate your help.

I checked DynamicDataDisplay.dll and found no ViewportHostPanel there. 

I will search the latest one. 

Do you know when ViewportHostPanel was bind to D3's assembly? recent? or couple years ago?

ViewportHostPanel appeared in D3 in the May of 2009.
--
Best regards,
Mikhail Brinchuk

Hi,Mikhail

Worked!

I overlooked the latest dll in the project you supplied.

I found ViewportHostPanel in the dll and  Intensity Chart project has been build.

the App work fine!

thank you very much!

 

you can call me zoot, you know?

I'm happy that this sample began to work.

By the way, Zoot, where are you from?

Hi,Mikhail

As you may have already noticed, I'm from Japan, I am Japanese.

I will count on you the next time!

thanks a lot!
